protocol_name: Cell Mito Stress Test for Monocyte Mitochondrial Function
protocol_name_html: Cell Mito Stress Test for Monocyte Mitochondrial Function

materials.reagent_name: Seahorse XFp Cell Mito Stress Test
0.1 M Sodium Bicarbonate Buffer, pH 8.0, Sterile
Pipettes and P1000, P200, P10 tips

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Aspirate Cell-Tak solution if not already done.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Aspirate Cell-Tak solution if not already done.

components.data: Add 50 μl medium to wells A and H and 50 μl cells to wells B-G. Samples are generally run in duplicate or triplicate on each plate. Cell number is 1.5×10^5 cells per well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 50 μl medium to wells A and H and 50 μl cells to wells B-G. Samples are generally run in duplicate or triplicate on each plate. Cell number is 1.5×10^5 cells per well.

components.data: Place plate in the carrier and place in centrifuge.  Spin 300×g for 1 minute without break.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place plate in the carrier and place in centrifuge.  Spin 300×g for 1 minute without break.

components.data: Add 130 μl assay medium to each well A-H (final volume 180 μl).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 130 μl assay medium to each well A-H (final volume 180 μl).

components.data: Incubate plate at 37degC in non-CO2 incubator for 1 hour.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate plate at 37degC in non-CO2 incubator for 1 hour.

components.data: While plate is incubating, perform steps 7 through 11
components.name: Description

source_data.description: While plate is incubating, perform steps 7 through 11

components.data:
Prepare preliminary drug dilutions (mix by pipetting up and down)

- 50 μM oligomycin (blue cap) - add 252 μl medium

- 50 μM FCCP (yellow cap) - add 288 μl medium

- 25 μM Rotenone/Antimycin A (red cap) - add 216 μl medium
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare preliminary drug dilutions (mix by pipetting up and down)

- 50 μM oligomycin (blue cap) - add 252 μl medium

- 50 μM FCCP (yellow cap) - add 288 μl medium

- 25 μM Rotenone/Antimycin A (red cap) - add 216 μl medium

components.data:
Prepare final drug dilutions

- 10 μM oligomycin - 120 μl of 50 μM oligomycin in 480 μl medium

- 20 μM FCCP - 120 μl of 50 μM FCCP in 180 μl medium

- 5 μM rotenone/antimycin A - 60 μl of 25 μM rot/AA in 240 μl medium
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare final drug dilutions

- 10 μM oligomycin - 120 μl of 50 μM oligomycin in 480 μl medium

- 20 μM FCCP - 120 μl of 50 μM FCCP in 180 μl medium

- 5 μM rotenone/antimycin A - 60 μl of 25 μM rot/AA in 240 μl medium

components.data: Remove sensor cartridge from incubator and remove and reinsert sensors briefly to clear air bubbles.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove sensor cartridge from incubator and remove and reinsert sensors briefly to clear air bubbles.

components.data:
Fill cartridge:

- Port A (all wells): 20 μl oligomycin (1 μM final concentration)

- Port B (all wells): 22 μl oligomycin (2 μM final concentration) (note 1)

- Port C (all wells): 25 μl FCCP (2 μM final concentration)

- Port D (all wells): 27 μl rotenone/antimycin A (0.5 μM final concentration)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Fill cartridge:

- Port A (all wells): 20 μl oligomycin (1 μM final concentration)

- Port B (all wells): 22 μl oligomycin (2 μM final concentration) (note 1)

- Port C (all wells): 25 μl FCCP (2 μM final concentration)

- Port D (all wells): 27 μl rotenone/antimycin A (0.5 μM final concentration)

source_data.annotation: (1) We do two separate injections of oligomycin, although one seems to work (although less consistently).  If one injection is desired, prepare oligomycin so that final concentration after the first injection is 2 μM.
source_data.thread_text: (1) We do two separate injections of oligomycin, although one seems to work (although less consistently).  If one injection is desired, prepare oligomycin so that final concentration after the first injection is 2 μM.
source_data.body: (1) We do two separate injections of oligomycin, although one seems to work (although less consistently).  If one injection is desired, prepare oligomycin so that final concentration after the first injection is 2 μM.

components.data: Select Cell Mito Stress Test program (note 2) on Seahorse XFp and calibrate sensor cartridge (remove lid).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Select Cell Mito Stress Test program (note 2) on Seahorse XFp and calibrate sensor cartridge (remove lid).

source_data.annotation: If two oligomycin injections are used, a custom program will need to be run.
source_data.thread_text: If two oligomycin injections are used, a custom program will need to be run.
source_data.body: If two oligomycin injections are used, a custom program will need to be run.

components.data: After 1 hour cell incubation, remove utility plate from XFp and insert cell plate (remove lid).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After 1 hour cell incubation, remove utility plate from XFp and insert cell plate (remove lid).

components.data: Run Cell Mito Stress Test.  3 measurements per injection (including basal) is sufficient.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run Cell Mito Stress Test.  3 measurements per injection (including basal) is sufficient.

components.data: After run is completed, image each well by photomicroscopy or collect and isolate protein from each well to normalize cell numbers.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After run is completed, image each well by photomicroscopy or collect and isolate protein from each well to normalize cell numbers.

components.data:
Materials to Prepare:

 

Seahorse DMEM Media:

Add 50 μl pyruvate, 50 μl L-glutamine, 20 μl glucose to 5 ml Seahorse Base Medium.  Sterile filter before use.

 

Cell-Tak coated XFp plate.

Prepare Cell-Tak.  Add Cell-Tak and sodium hydroxide to 0.1 M sodium bicarbonate so that each well will receive 0.56 μg Cell-Tak, and sodium hydroxide concentration will be 0.63 mM.  Cell-Tak concentration varies by batch, so calculations for each new batch will need to be performed.  Add 25 μl Cell-Tak solution to each well.  Plates can be stored at room temperature (at least 20 minutes) until use (for a few hours).  Plates can also be prepped prior to assay day by incubating plates in Cell-Tak (at least 20 minutes), then aspirating remaining solution, air drying, and storing at 4degC until use.

 

Monocytes

Monocytes should be prepared as directed in the monocyte isolation protocol (https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.kwtcxen).  Isolated monocytes should be diluted to a concentration of 3×10^6 cells / ml in prepared Seahorse DMEM media prior to use in the assay.  Use monocytes immediately.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Materials to Prepare:

 

Seahorse DMEM Media:

Add 50 μl pyruvate, 50 μl L-glutamine, 20 μl glucose to 5 ml Seahorse Base Medium.  Sterile filter before use.

 

Cell-Tak coated XFp plate.

Prepare Cell-Tak.  Add Cell-Tak and sodium hydroxide to 0.1 M sodium bicarbonate so that each well will receive 0.56 μg Cell-Tak, and sodium hydroxide concentration will be 0.63 mM.  Cell-Tak concentration varies by batch, so calculations for each new batch will need to be performed.  Add 25 μl Cell-Tak solution to each well.  Plates can be stored at room temperature (at least 20 minutes) until use (for a few hours).  Plates can also be prepped prior to assay day by incubating plates in Cell-Tak (at least 20 minutes), then aspirating remaining solution, air drying, and storing at 4degC until use.

 

Monocytes

Monocytes should be prepared as directed in the monocyte isolation protocol (https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.kwtcxen).  Isolated monocytes should be diluted to a concentration of 3×10^6 cells / ml in prepared Seahorse DMEM media prior to use in the assay.  Use monocytes immediately.

components.data:
Day Prior to Assay:

-Turn on XFp analyzer to warm up overnight

-Hydrate XFp sensor cartridge

    Add 200 μl XF calibration solution (included with FluxPak) to each

    well.  Add 400 μl sterile PBS or H2O to each moat.  Incubate
    overnight at 37degC in non-CO2 incubator.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Day Prior to Assay:

-Turn on XFp analyzer to warm up overnight

-Hydrate XFp sensor cartridge

    Add 200 μl XF calibration solution (included with FluxPak) to each

    well.  Add 400 μl sterile PBS or H2O to each moat.  Incubate
    overnight at 37degC in non-CO2 incubator.

components.data:
Data Analysis

 

Data can be analyzed in the following manner.  Averages or mean/max for each condition can be used.

 

Basal Respiration: (unstimulated OCR) - (rotenone_antimycin A OCR)

 

ATP-Linked Respiration: (unstimulated OCR) - (oligomycin OCR)

 

Respiratory Capacity (Maximal Respiration): (FCCP OCR) - (rotenone_antimycin A OCR)

 

Spare Capacity: (FCCP OCR) - (unstimulated OCR)

 

Proton Leak: (oligomycin OCR) - (rotenone_antimycin A OCR)

 

Non-Mitochondrial Respiration: (rotenone_antimycin A OCR)

 

Calculations are depicted in Figure 1.

 

Figure 1: Cell Mito Stress Test calculations
